candidates.title: Bump `elliptic-curve` to v0.12; `ecdsa` to v0.14
candidates.body: Updates to the final releases of these two crates

candidates.title: Have `pkcs8` feature activate `ecdsa/pkcs8`
candidates.body: This enables PKCS#8 support for the generic `SigningKey` and `VerifyingKey` types from the `ecdsa` crate when the `pkcs8` feature of any of the elliptic curve crates is enabled.

candidates.title: k256: fallible `AffinePoint` to `VerifyingKey` conversion
candidates.body:
The inner type of `VerifyingKey` is a `PublicKey`, which is itself a wrapper for an inner curve-specific `AffinePoint` which ensures that the inner point is *NOT* the additive identity / point at infinity.

Therefore, any conversion from an `AffinePoint` is potentially fallible, so the existing `From` conversions need to be changed to `TryFrom`.

This commit also adds some additional type conversions between `AffinePoint`/`ProjectivePoint` and `PublicKey`/`VerifyingKey`, and also includes them in `p256` for consistency.

candidates.title: Bump versions to prereleases
candidates.body: Now that #515 which upgrades to prereleases of the `elliptic-curve` and `ecdsa` crates has been merged, bump the version numbers of all crates to prereleases to indicate breaking changes have been made.

candidates.title: Fix `hash2curve` crate feature
candidates.body: The `hash2curve` crate feature actually requires the `arithmetic` crate feature. The reason why CI didn't catch it is because any tests using `hash2curve` are hidden behind modules behind the `arithmetic` crate feature.

candidates.title: Update elliptic-curve, digest and ecdsa
candidates.body: This builds on RustCrypto/traits#883 and RustCrypto/signatures#433.

candidates.title: p384: rename arithmetic feature to `broken-arithmetic-do-not-use`
candidates.body:
The arithmetic implementations as they currently exist are known to be broken, so to prevent someone from accidentally attempting to use them unknowingly, renames the feature to `broken-arithmetic-do-not-use`.

Additionally removes the derived `invert` and `sqrt` methods.

candidates.title: Implement `VoprfParameters` for `NistP256` and `NistP384`
candidates.body:
See RustCrypto/traits#878.
Reference: https://www.ietf.org/archive/id/draft-irtf-cfrg-voprf-08.html#section-4.

candidates.title: p384: add basic tests for `Scalar` arithmetic
candidates.body:
Currently not passing and flagged with `#[ignore]`.

Also moves `montgomery_reduce` into the `Scalar` type as a static method

candidates.title: p384: add `AffinePoint`
candidates.body:
Partial implementation of `AffinePoint`, with coordinates internally represented using `FieldElement` type which wraps fiat-crypto's base field arithmetic.

With this in place, `FieldElement` can be removed from the public API without any warnings about dead code.

Note: the implementation is not yet fully correct and some of the tests have been flagged with `#[ignore]`.

candidates.title: p384: scalar arithmetic
candidates.body:
Note: currently 64-bit only

Adds an initial scalar arithmetic backend combining `crypto-bigint` and `elliptic_curve::ScalarCore`-based functionality with arithmetic generated using the `ff_derive` crate for functions that `crypto-bigint` presently doesn't support.

Constants such as the multiplicative generator and root of unity calculated using SageMath:

```sage
sage: n = 0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffc7634d81f4372ddf581a0db248b0a77aecec196accc52973
sage: GF(n).primitive_element()
2
sage: s = 1
sage: t = (n - 1) >> s
sage: t
19701003098197239606139520050071806902539869635232723333973452639813829699556631784699478154076147456777216826971321
sage: power_mod(2,t,n)
39402006196394479212279040100143613805079739270465446667946905279627659399113263569398956308152294913554433653942642
```

candidates.title: k256+p256: use revised `LinearCombination` trait
candidates.body: See RustCrypto/traits#835

candidates.title: Cargo.lock: bump dependencies
candidates.body: Picks up `ecdsa` v0.13.2 released in https://github.com/RustCrypto/signatures/pull/418

candidates.title: k256+p256: impl `LinearCombination` trait
candidates.body:
Adds impls of traits for linear combinations added in RustCrypto/traits#833:

- `k256` uses an optimized implementation.
- `p256` uses the default unoptimized implementation.

candidates.title: k256: impl `ReduceNonZero<U512>` for `Scalar`
candidates.body:
Provides an impl of the `ReduceNonZero` trait added in [RustCrypto/elliptic-curves#827](https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/827), which provides a reduction from a 512-bit (64-byte) input, i.e. a "wide" reduction from an integer twice the size of the curve's order, to a `Scalar` which is guaranteed to be non-zero.

Based on @fjarri's work in #432

candidates.title: k256: use `ecdsa::hazmat::rfc6979_generate_k`
candidates.body:
The extraction of the RFC6979 implementation in the `ecdsa` crate into the `rfc6979` crate resulted in a suboptimal API for general use.

This commit uses a helper function added in `ecdsa` v0.13.1 which simplifies the API.

  - `group` v0.11

candidates.title: Bump `elliptic-curve` crate dependency to v0.11
candidates.body: Release notes: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/821

candidates.title: p256: add serde `Serialize`/`Deserialize` impls
candidates.body:
Adds impls of `serde` traits for the following types:

- `AffinePoint`
- `Scalar`

candidates.title: k256: add serde `Serialize`/`Deserialize` impls
candidates.body:
Adds impls of `serde` traits for the following types:

- `AffinePoint`
- `Scalar`
- `ecdsa::VerifyingKey`

candidates.title: Add `serde` feature
candidates.body: Adds a `serde` feature to all crates which activates the corresponding `serde` feature in the `ecdsa`, `elliptic-curve`, and `sec1` crates.

candidates.title: Update `ecdsa` crate and leverage generic ECDSA implementations
candidates.body:
This updates the crates in this repo to leverage the following generic implementations recently added to the `ecdsa` crate:

- Sign: RustCrypto/signatures#396
- Verify: RustCrypto/signatures#397

The `p256` crate is able to directly utilize the generic implementation from the `ecdsa` crate.

The `k256` crate retains its previous custom implementation, which provides a secp256k1-specific take on public key recovery, but can also directly leverage optimizations for computing linear combinations, which there are not presently traits in `elliptic-curve` or `group` to express.

candidates.title: Use released RustCrypto/formats crates
candidates.body: Removes the git-based dependencies

candidates.title: Update `pkcs8` crate
candidates.body: Updates to the latest git version of the `pkcs8` crate, which uses `TryFrom` to handle the final step of decoding keys

candidates.title: Bump dependencies
candidates.body: Updates to the latest `elliptic-curve` and RustCrypto/formats crates

candidates.title: Rust 2021 edition upgrade; MSRV 1.56+
candidates.body:
The `elliptic-curve` and `ecdsa` crates as well as format parsers including `der`, `sec1`, and `pkcs8` have all been bumped to Rust 2021 edition:

- https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/795
- https://github.com/RustCrypto/signatures/pull/384

This commit updates the crates in this repo accordingly.

candidates.title: Bump `pkcs8` crate; update encoding traits
candidates.body: Updates `pkcs8` and related crates to use the new trait names after they were renamed in RustCrypto/formats#121.

candidates.title: Use prerelease format parsers
candidates.body: Pull in the prerelease format parsers so we can properly integration test them for the elliptic curve use case.

candidates.title: k256+p256: make `FromEncodedPoint` return a `CtOption`
candidates.body:
Corresponding changes for:

https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/782

Internally these were already returning `CtOption` anyway. It should also simplify the implementation of `GroupEncoding`.

candidates.title: k256+p256: replace `ecdsa::hazmat::FromDigest` with `Reduce`
candidates.body:
The `FromDigest` trait has been removed from the `ecdsa` crate, in favor of using the `Reduce` trait:

https://github.com/RustCrypto/signatures/pull/372

This is the corresponding set of changes to the above upstream PR to the `ecdsa` crate which implements this change.

candidates.title: Use the `sec1` v0.1 crate release
candidates.body: Bumps `elliptic-curve` and `ecdsa` git hashes and removes patch dependencies for `der` and `sec1`.

candidates.title: Updates for `sec1` crate
candidates.body:
These code changes are necessary to support a migration to the `sec1` crate, which extracted types like `EncodedPoint` into a separate reusable crate.

Relevant `elliptic-curve` PR:

https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/771

candidates.title: Bump `elliptic-curve` crate; add `sec1` crate patches
candidates.body:
Updates `elliptic-curve` to a new version which uses the (unreleased) `sec1 crate.

See RustCrypto/traits#765

candidates.title: k256+p256: use `UInt::add_mod` for scalar addition
candidates.body:
`crypto-bigint` v0.2.7 fixed a bug in `UInt::add_mod` in https://github.com/RustCrypto/utils/pull/619, and the `elliptic-curve` crate has been updated to depend on this version at a minimum.

This means we can now use it to implement scalar addition.
